Simplex Noise Terrain

Smooth noise surfaces, like perlin and simple noise, allow a straight forward way to procedurally generate landscapes. In this example, a 2D simplex noise surface is used to define the height, and therefore 'tile', for each cell in a 2d map.


Each cells height value is sampled by scaling the cells location with a parameter meant to scale the noise surface. This parameter, along with the thresholds for water and mountain levels, have relevant controls exposed above.
